Text: Re CES and CEM Cc CEM will still exist for awhile maybe forever due to legal issues I wouldnt begin canceling anything as the Choice customers are still in CESs name and we dont want any capacity returning or other problems They should begin to be transferred to NPC soon Why dont you hold off for now Larry Friedeman is actually the last CES employee and can be reached in his Toledo office through Chris CT PM To Colleen CT Timothy L ES cc Michael H ES Jeffrey ES Scott NRON Subject CES and CEM I believe ENA is still agent for Columbia Energy Services and Columbia Energy Marketing on several pipelines Rich Contoss the only CES person I know last day is this Friday I left Rich a voicemail asking him if CESCEM should continue to exist as a legal entity on the pipelines As ENA I believe I sould at least begin terminating the agency and liability relationships Commentsquestions
Nomsfrom storage
TCO Cc found dthd at MacClendantown A for CPA We only need there now will get you upstream info
Nomsfrom storage please

COH OFO Cc NOTICE COH OFOOMO Date Issued December As a result of returning cold weather and significant underdeliveries by shippers on the Columbia Gas of Ohio COH system COH is calling an Operational Flow Order and an Operational Matching Order OMO for all COH Gas Transportation Customers The OFOOMO is effective on gas day December and will remain in effect until further notice If conditions warrant these orders will be lifted to reflect the changing conditions and COH will advise you of such changes Customer and marketer banks are not available during the OFOOMO period This notice is applicable to the Customer Choice program CHOICE deliveries should always equal the customers demand curve The OFO requires the same level of delivery but the tariff provides for additional costs for failure to comply Customers with daily measurement devices are subject to the OMO Those customers or their shippers are directed to adjust the customers consumption andor their deliveries to COH so that their deliveries to COH are equal to the customers actual consumption Customers without daily measurement devices are subject to the OFO Those customers are hereby directed to adjust their daily scheduled deliveries to COH so that those deliveries are equal to of the customers maximum daily volume as specified in the customers gas transportation contract with COH Those customers or their shippers who fail to comply with this OFOOMO shall be subject to penalties for the difference as provided for in COHs tariff COH will continue to monitor weather conditions and demand in order to remove the OFOOMO as soon as possible If you have questions regarding this notice please contact your Columbia Gas Representative
Nomsfrom Storage cold for next days

Re Gas Daily stuffmy sheet again it is adjusted to pool and the st is still good Since COH is the only TCO market with any swing I am sticking with those to calculate We look off on I have FOM NP BuyTCO usage sell to NPC These were TCO totals but my COH numbers on match adjusted for F to pool

Re Gas Daily stuffhave it a little different is a sale from NPC to ENA we are off by to st is Chris CT AM To Jeffrey ES cc Subject Gas Daily stuff This is what Im showing as gas daily activity for the st thru the th Date Undertake Overtake I buy the Undertakes and sell you the Overtakes Do these numbers look close

Jan FOMagreed per Chris G we have d at FOM price We also bought additional d from Dick J which may be part of this deal Coh Numbers on JanDailyEst include about d of storage WD noted at bottom of sheet COH also includes d purchased at Toledo AggNPC buying and d at A Agg See attached JanCohChoiceEna CPA includes d at BRCobb d at TetcoDelmont and at A We will do BuySell on rd party so ENA can transport Will pass on upstream K next week

Re DEC TCO Cc On ENA FOM there are CPA details Dick says you have info for at A McCThe FOM numbers are details of what we want for pricing see Chris Also see changes and estimates on other sheet for COH noms I will have forcasted numbers tommorrow morning
Re ndknow we overan SST in COH Our nom was lower but the retro increased Alvin Joanne were checking TCO We are hoping they dont cut us and dont want to tip them that they could

TCO Contractsneed to get from you a detailed list of contracts on TCO that have been assigned to ENA from either CES or NPC Specifically I am looking for RPs DPs and the associated primary volumes The monthly contract list tracks demand charges OK but is not good enough for pathing gas in Winter Give me a call when you get back to discuss

Supplies for CPAJanit is similar to Dec CPA only gave us dth primary to and Jan demand is dth I have a call in to CPA go ahead and nom on K Chris was checking on your side Have additional bought from EES at A for COH I will send latest guess for COH Jan later real forcast AM Producer thinks you are swinging on it for Dec

Latest estimateforcast on AM We have bought at PEPLMaumee A from EES on K to be used where Toledo Agg is noted Per TCO we should be fine on all those noms We have also bought from EES at A on K for COH and This includes the we have been buying for Nov Dec but is in addition to the for CPA So total from EES at A for CPACOH for Jan d

Jan FOMForwarded by Jeffrey PorterHOUEES on PM PM Jeffrey Porter Jeffrey Porter Jeffrey Porter PM PM To ENA COH Nominations cc Subject Jan FOM As agreed per Chris G we have d at FOM price We also bought additional d from Dick J which may be part of this deal Coh Numbers on JanDailyEst include about d of storage WD noted at bottom of sheet COH also includes d purchased at Toledo AggNPC buying and d at A Agg See attached JanCohChoiceEna CPA includes d at BRCobb d at TetcoDelmont and at A We will do BuySell on rd party so ENA can transport Will pass on upstream K next week

Re Correction to Numbers AM Jeffrey Porter Jeffrey Porter Jeffrey Porter AM AM To Chris CT cc Subject Correction to Numbers I omitted the details for CPA demand on Joanns TCO sheet needs to be TGP BrunCobb rd while the remainder will be split beteen A A and LeachPool I will send you details on Monday

TCOCOH Storagewant to check if we are on the same page for storage WD for Nov Through Actuals I show we have WD dth from storage or adjusted for TCO Fuel at the CG Could you please let me know where you are at Per the Proxy we are targeting WD of sto or CG for the EOM Let me know jpp
Re DEC TCO Cc forgetting we are buying that package of d at the agg pool to be taken to COH Same as last month Dominion K

Re Downstream Contracts at Toledo Cc at Toledo for Forwarded by Jeffrey PorterHOUEES on PM AM Jeffrey Porter Jeffrey Porter Jeffrey Porter AM AM To cc Subject Re Downstream Contracts at Toledo Forwarded by Jeffrey PorterHOUEES on AM AM Jeffrey Porter Jeffrey Porter Jeffrey Porter AM AM To Monica ES cc Timothy L ES Subject Re Downstream Contracts at Toledo New Noms for at ANRTCO Monclova K Monica Roberts AM To Jeffrey ES cc Subject Re Downstream Contracts at Toledo Jeff the Dynegy scheduler is Jeff North His phone number is His pager is I have left him a voicemail and just paged him so as soon as I talk with him Im going to ask him to call you Hopefully with you guys talking directly you can figure out why the gas isnt flowing Please keep me posted as to what I can do to help Monica x PM Jeffrey Porter Jeffrey Porter Jeffrey Porter PM PM To Monica ES cc Subject Downstream Contracts at Toledo Here are the downstream contracts for NPCs purchase at TCO Toledo for Jan Please let me know your upstreams Thanks JPP x Toledo RP Volume K

Re Gas for Cc through MONDAY not AM Jeffrey Porter Jeffrey Porter Jeffrey Porter AM AM To Chris CT cc Michael H GarredHOUEES Subject Gas for JWe bought d from a rd party for through Please pull from our TCO Pool Our daily forcasted noms will reflect this C Should we do this at GD rather than IF FOM
Gas for Cc d from a rd party for through Please pull from our TCO Pool Our daily forcasted noms will reflect this C Should we do this at GD rather than IF FOM

Re Supply Bought by NPC Cc RD should be part of our daily demand for COH from ENA not in addition to ie d demand AGG POOL sto IPP Also please pull directly from Agg Pool to transport K not through IPP Pool as it may get cut Chris CT AM To Jeffrey ES Joann NRON Alvin nron Dave ES cc Victoria CT Subject Re Supply Bought by NPC I created deal purchase from New Power and deal sale to New Power I will price both deals using the FOM index pricing AM Jeffrey ES Jeffrey ES Jeffrey ES AM AM To cc Michael H GarredHOUEES Chris CT Dave ScottHOUEES Subject Supply Bought by NPC We bought this and need you to move to COH as part of CESNPC Nov demand dd delivered to COH from Agg point A Contract AS Supplier Dominion Field Services is the supplier call if you have questions

Supply Bought by NPC Cc this and need you to move to COH as part of CESNPC Nov demand dd delivered to COH from Agg point A Contract AS Supplier Dominion Field Services is the supplier call if you have questions

Re Actualsthe th yes we swung down to nearly zero on storage but in a few markets we were delivering SST from pool and FT and had to overdeliver It gets banked and cashed out annually that is about the discrepancey I see over the last days Chris CT PM To Jeffrey ES cc Subject Re Actuals Just looking high level I see days where storage is off by more than dts that I will check into Date Sitara Jeffs th th th I dont understand your storage number on the th Does that mean you banked gas that day Also I setup a column for Navigator numbers and it looks like we took out for ENA I need to reconcile storage back to Nov so I can track what we took out vs what we pay New Power for

Re November FOM Volumes Cc are more like total storage and net The pricing method also sounds good Joanne if you look at David Scotts worksheet for the st we split out flowing vs storage We are trying to average d from storage for the month per the CES agreement but we want to save some of that for cold spikes later in the month We will probably ask the storage daily amount to increase to d by midmonth then to d near the end so as to hit that monthly target We also bought d of agg pool gas we need you to haul to COH We will let you know agg contract when we get it Im out but back on Monday Chris CT PM To Dave ES Jeffrey ES cc Joann NRON Alvin nron Victoria CT Subject Re November FOM Volumes I just spoke with Joann and this is what we are coming up with on CGAS Est Citygate for Nov Storage Withdrawal Net Purchase from ENA Does this look correct We would enter a citygate sell to New Power for and a purchase from New Power of grossed up for fuel AND Dave it looks like you might have or more worksheets that you are maintaining Do you want to try and do away with any of them All I really need are the FOM numbers buy pipeline buy pricing zone

Re Daily volumes for and Cc OK to us Look for a change in our format Chris CT AM To Dave ES Jeffrey ES Victoria CT cc Subject Re Daily volumes for and Maybe we should add another section to Mr Scotts worksheet for Third Party buys and sells like the Aquilla deal and the deal we did on the th where ENA bought the gas back from New Power Not a big deal for October but we will probably start doing our maunal billing process again for the winter months I could see you guys buying incremental third party gas that we may need to schedule especially during high pipeline constraints Example You might buy gas from Sempra at Eagle into CGAS and we use your transport to get it to a citygate ENA would buy it from New Power at Eagel and sell it back to New Power at the citygate We should let you know what the deal ticket number is via email or phone call and Scott could put it on the worksheet So if we had this tab for October it would just have deals on it so far Comments

Re Nov Capacity Cc DP should be COH Parma please confirm Also there should be d Leach to COH released from COH to CES to ENA AM Jeffrey Porter Jeffrey Porter Jeffrey Porter AM AM To Chris CT cc ECT Michael H ES Victoria CT Dave ScottHOUEES Subject Re Nov Capacity That looks like them Heres the ratesdemand Charges You also had d on your capacity email Toledo to Sandusky Contract should be at
Re Nov Capacity Cc like them Heres the ratesdemand Charges You also had d on your capacity email Toledo to Sandusky Contract should be at

Re Purchase from ENAthink there was a problem Were not my numbers OK Chris CT AM To Jeffrey ES cc Subject Re Purchase from ENA Did Tim and Dick ever chat about the FOM stuff What numbers should I be using now FOM number Volume sold back at Index Flat AM Jeffrey ES Jeffrey ES Jeffrey ES AM AM To Chris CT cc Subject Purchase from ENA I bought d at the TCO Pool from Dick J at for through At first he was concerned we were swinging on ENA and not storage and I assured him you folks knew what volume we buysell GD as soon as you get my nom I have even included my estimate on the bottom of my daily nom sheet
Re Feb allocated stuffnumbers look good I had the wrong number in the volume we were pulling from your pool

NPC Mar Cc you have any upstream contracts for CVA or CMD As for CPA we have bought at Broadrun Cobb from East Ohio Gas K We will buy FOM from you at the pool plus we plan to buy at A Nothing at A for Mar So of the FOM gas Ex plus hedges CG we will use CPA CVA and CMD The remaining or pool will be pulled into NPC App Pool from ENA App Pool I will let you know A assoonasigetit
CPAat BrCobb K from ENA Pool at A K at c Tetco Delmont K TBDetermined Please use as Feb COH on its way

COH OFO Cc NOTICE COH OFOOMO Date Issued December As a result of returning cold weather and significant underdeliveries by shippers on the Columbia Gas of Ohio COH system COH is calling an Operational Flow Order and an Operational Matching Order OMO for all COH Gas Transportation Customers The OFOOMO is effective on gas day December and will remain in effect until further notice If conditions warrant these orders will be lifted to reflect the changing conditions and COH will advise you of such changes Customer and marketer banks are not available during the OFOOMO period This notice is applicable to the Customer Choice program CHOICE deliveries should always equal the customers demand curve The OFO requires the same level of delivery but the tariff provides for additional costs for failure to comply Customers with daily measurement devices are subject to the OMO Those customers or their shippers are directed to adjust the customers consumption andor their deliveries to COH so that their deliveries to COH are equal to the customers actual consumption Customers without daily measurement devices are subject to the OFO Those customers are hereby directed to adjust their daily scheduled deliveries to COH so that those deliveries are equal to of the customers maximum daily volume as specified in the customers gas transportation contract with COH Those customers or their shippers who fail to comply with this OFOOMO shall be subject to penalties for the difference as provided for in COHs tariff COH will continue to monitor weather conditions and demand in order to remove the OFOOMO as soon as possible If you have questions regarding this notice please contact your Columbia Gas Representative
